p: Transmission of the virus to humans is primarily through the bite of an infected Aedes mosquito species, although transmission may also occur through several non-vector-borne routes, including pre- and peri-natal transmission, sexual intercourse, and blood transfusions [ 6, 7, 8]. The increasing worldwide presence of the Aedes mosquito species may lead to the emergence of new ZIKV epidemics in urban areas [ 9].
